Original: Original
Dialogue: Dialogue

Original: Lunafreya Nox Fleuret:(narrating)For centuries the sacred magic of theDivine Crystalblessed our world and its people.
Dialogue: (narrating)For centuries the sacred magic of theDivine Crystalblessed our world and its people.

Original: Lunafreya:(narrating)But, in time, the promise of its power brought war to our lands.
Dialogue: (narrating)But, in time, the promise of its power brought war to our lands.

Original: Lunafreya:(narrating)Amid the escalating war, Prince Noctis of Lucis had come to Tenebrae to seek healing for a grievous injury. He made the long journey together with his father, King Regis.
Dialogue: (narrating)Amid the escalating war, Prince Noctis of Lucis had come to Tenebrae to seek healing for a grievous injury. He made the long journey together with his father, King Regis.

Original: Lunafreya:(narrating)Mother, brother, and I, the royalty of Tenebrae, had all welcomed their visit.
Dialogue: (narrating)Mother, brother, and I, the royalty of Tenebrae, had all welcomed their visit.

Original: Lunafreya:(narrating)It was then that the fires came, everywhere and all at once.
Dialogue: (narrating)It was then that the fires came, everywhere and all at once.

Original: Lunafreya:(narrating)In a mere instant, the whole of Tenebrae was ablaze.
Dialogue: (narrating)In a mere instant, the whole of Tenebrae was ablaze.

Original: Ravus Nox Fleuret:Mother!
Dialogue: Mother!

Original: Regis Lucis Caelum:General Glauca.
Dialogue: General Glauca.

Original: Luna:(narrating)The Niflheim attack was an attempt on the lives of the visiting Lucian royalty.
Dialogue: (narrating)The Niflheim attack was an attempt on the lives of the visiting Lucian royalty.

Original: Ravus:Please, help us! King Regis!
Dialogue: Please, help us! King Regis!

Original: Noctis Lucis Caelum:Luna!
Dialogue: Luna!

Original: Lunafreya:(narrating)From that day until this day, Tenebrae has been gripped in the iron fist of Niflheim, sworn enemy of Lucis.
Dialogue: (narrating)From that day until this day, Tenebrae has been gripped in the iron fist of Niflheim, sworn enemy of Lucis.

Original: Libertus Ostium:What's the hold-up, Crowe?
Dialogue: What's the hold-up, Crowe?

Original: Crowe:(into earpiece)Almost there...
Dialogue: (into earpiece)Almost there...

Original: Pelna Khara:Lucis isn't paying us refugees enough for this!
Dialogue: Lucis isn't paying us refugees enough for this!

Original: Pelna:How is this fair?
Dialogue: How is this fair?

Original: Pelna:Nyx, I owe you one.
Dialogue: Nyx, I owe you one.

Original: Nyx:You and everyone else.
Dialogue: You and everyone else.

Original: Nyx:I'm on my way. Pelna, fall back and regroup with the others.
Dialogue: I'm on my way. Pelna, fall back and regroup with the others.

Original: Pelna:Go easy on the magic, hero. You got people waiting for you back home.
Dialogue: Go easy on the magic, hero. You got people waiting for you back home.

Original: Nyx:I'm worth the wait.
Dialogue: I'm worth the wait.

Original: Luche:(over radio)Watch your back, Libertus. We got more incoming.
Dialogue: (over radio)Watch your back, Libertus. We got more incoming.

Original: Libertus:We ain't gonna last much longer. Crowe!
Dialogue: We ain't gonna last much longer. Crowe!

Original: Luche:(over radio)All Glaives, fall back. Repeat, all Glaives fall back!
Dialogue: (over radio)All Glaives, fall back. Repeat, all Glaives fall back!

Original: Niflheim Man:Release the daemon.
Dialogue: Release the daemon.

Original: Captain Drautos:(over radio)We can't take down that daemon. I'm ordering a full retreat. Get back here alive. That's an order. For hearth and home.
Dialogue: (over radio)We can't take down that daemon. I'm ordering a full retreat. Get back here alive. That's an order. For hearth and home.

Original: Glaive:(over radio)All units, fall back to the extraction point. Support is inbound.
Dialogue: (over radio)All units, fall back to the extraction point. Support is inbound.

Original: Luche:Nyx! We have to get out of here. Nyx! We have orders!
Dialogue: Nyx! We have to get out of here. Nyx! We have orders!

Original: Girl's Voice:(memory)Help!
Dialogue: (memory)Help!

Original: Nyx:Oh, that idiot.
Dialogue: Oh, that idiot.

Original: Pelna:Crowe, we gotta move.
Dialogue: Crowe, we gotta move.

Original: Libertus:You gotta be kidding me.
Dialogue: You gotta be kidding me.

Original: Libertus:Whoa, whoa, whoa! You know I ain't got the stomach for this crap.
Dialogue: Whoa, whoa, whoa! You know I ain't got the stomach for this crap.

Original: Captain Drautos:Luche, report.
Dialogue: Luche, report.

Original: Luche:The imperial forces look to be withdrawing, sir.
Dialogue: The imperial forces look to be withdrawing, sir.

Original: Libertus:Guess I owe you another one.
Dialogue: Guess I owe you another one.

Original: Nyx:I'll put it on your tab. You just try and get some rest, alright?
Dialogue: I'll put it on your tab. You just try and get some rest, alright?

Original: Captain Drautos:You disobeyed a direct order to retreat.
Dialogue: You disobeyed a direct order to retreat.

Original: Nyx:"For hearth and home," right, sir? As long as I got strength in my body, I obeythatorder.
Dialogue: "For hearth and home," right, sir? As long as I got strength in my body, I obeythatorder.

Original: Captain Drautos:Don't fool yourself, Nyx Ulric. Whatever strength you have is on loan from the king. You are nothing without him. Await details of your reassignment.
Dialogue: Don't fool yourself, Nyx Ulric. Whatever strength you have is on loan from the king. You are nothing without him. Await details of your reassignment.

Original: Captain Drautos:Yes, Your Majesty. Despite their victory all but assured.
Dialogue: Yes, Your Majesty. Despite their victory all but assured.

Original: King Regis:A sudden and inexplicable retreat.
Dialogue: A sudden and inexplicable retreat.

Original: Clarus Amicitia:We are at risk nonetheless, Your Majesty. We cannot know when they will strike again.
Dialogue: We are at risk nonetheless, Your Majesty. We cannot know when they will strike again.

Original: Man:Your Majesty, word from the West Gate. A man claiming to be an envoy of the Empire requests an audience.
Dialogue: Your Majesty, word from the West Gate. A man claiming to be an envoy of the Empire requests an audience.

Original: Man:(voice over)The envoy from Niflheim awaits without, Your Majesty.
Dialogue: (voice over)The envoy from Niflheim awaits without, Your Majesty.

Original: ???:Hello there. Hello! Good day to you...and you. Well met, my dear Lucians.
Dialogue: Hello there. Hello! Good day to you...and you. Well met, my dear Lucians.

Original: King Regis:Has Niflheim grown so bold that they send the chancellor himself as envoy? And under no guard, at that?
Dialogue: Has Niflheim grown so bold that they send the chancellor himself as envoy? And under no guard, at that?

Original: Chancellor Izunia:It is an honor to be recognized by the great King Regis! Yet, permit me to stand on ceremony and introduce myself nonetheless.
Dialogue: It is an honor to be recognized by the great King Regis! Yet, permit me to stand on ceremony and introduce myself nonetheless.

Original: Chancellor Izunia:Ardyn Izunia, chancellor of Niflheim, at your humble service. And I come to you on this most auspicious of days to offer terms of peace.
Dialogue: Ardyn Izunia, chancellor of Niflheim, at your humble service. And I come to you on this most auspicious of days to offer terms of peace.

Original: Chancellor Izunia:As you no doubt surmised, that recent maneuver of ours was no strategic retreat. Call it...
Dialogue: As you no doubt surmised, that recent maneuver of ours was no strategic retreat. Call it...

Original: Chancellor Izunia:A gesture of imperial goodwill. Like you, we wish nothing more than to bring a swift end to this senseless war.
Dialogue: A gesture of imperial goodwill. Like you, we wish nothing more than to bring a swift end to this senseless war.

Original: King Regis:Is that so?
Dialogue: Is that so?

Original: Chancellor Izunia:It is, indeed. And we require but a singular compliance: save your grand Insomnia here, Lucis must forfeit all territories to Niflheim rule.
Dialogue: It is, indeed. And we require but a singular compliance save your grand Insomnia here, Lucis must forfeit all territories to Niflheim rule.

Original: Chancellor Izunia:Ah, Insomnia! The jewel in the crown of the Lucian kingdom. How foolish of me to forget. There is just one more trivial thing. It concerns your son. The fetching Prince Noctis of Lucis and the fair Princess Lunafreya of Tenebrae...they are to be wed. You seem vexed, Your Highness. I assure you, the princess still holds you in the highest regard as she has done all these twelve long years.
Dialogue: Ah, Insomnia! The jewel in the crown of the Lucian kingdom. How foolish of me to forget. There is just one more trivial thing. It concerns your son. The fetching Prince Noctis of Lucis and the fair Princess Lunafreya of Tenebrae...they are to be wed. You seem vexed, Your Highness. I assure you, the princess still holds you in the highest regard as she has done all these twelve long years.

Original: Petra:Do yourself a favor, take a look around. This is what a hundred years of peace looks like. It's a lasting peace made by the Wall and the Wall alone.
Dialogue: Do yourself a favor, take a look around. This is what a hundred years of peace looks like. It's a lasting peace made by the Wall and the Wall alone.

Original: Petra:See, we don't need any of you immigrants jumping around, playing war hero.
Dialogue: See, we don't need any of you immigrants jumping around, playing war hero.

Original: Libertus:Hey! Rough day on the gate, huh, Glaive?
Dialogue: Hey! Rough day on the gate, huh, Glaive?

Original: Crowe:You jerk! It's your fault he got stuck there!
Dialogue: You jerk! It's your fault he got stuck there!

Original: Nyx:Not a very nice welcome for a big hero.
Dialogue: Not a very nice welcome for a big hero.

Original: Crowe:Not a very nice outfit for one, either.
Dialogue: Not a very nice outfit for one, either.

Original: Nyx:I think it brings out my eyes.
Dialogue: I think it brings out my eyes.

Original: Crowe:Hey, Libertus. You thank Nyx for saving your life yet?
Dialogue: Hey, Libertus. You thank Nyx for saving your life yet?

Original: Libertus:Oh, come on, Crowe. Nyx and I are too close for that. He helps me, I help him. That's the way it's always been.
Dialogue: Oh, come on, Crowe. Nyx and I are too close for that. He helps me, I help him. That's the way it's always been.

Original: Nyx:Looks like you got a little help from something else, huh?
Dialogue: Looks like you got a little help from something else, huh?

Original: Libertus:I need all I can get.
Dialogue: I need all I can get.

Original: Pelna:For hearth!
Dialogue: For hearth!

Original: Glaives:(together)And home.
Dialogue: (together)And home.

Original: Pelna:So, Nyx the Gatekeeper. How's the new post treating you?
Dialogue: So, Nyx the Gatekeeper. How's the new post treating you?

Original: Nyx:Oh, it's amazing. You guys would love it. The gate watch are real sweethearts.
Dialogue: Oh, it's amazing. You guys would love it. The gate watch are real sweethearts.

Original: Pelna:Ha-ha-ha. Yeah, right. We all know they hate us outsiders more than anything. So bored they got nothing better to do.
Dialogue: Ha-ha-ha. Yeah, right. We all know they hate us outsiders more than anything. So bored they got nothing better to do.

Original: Nyx:Boredom's not so bad. Means there's peace, at least. I'd fight a hundred more wars for Galahdans to know boredom.
Dialogue: Boredom's not so bad. Means there's peace, at least. I'd fight a hundred more wars for Galahdans to know boredom.

Original: Pelna:Fight all you want. Just don't go dying yet. I still owe you. Alot.
Dialogue: Fight all you want. Just don't go dying yet. I still owe you. Alot.

Original: Libertus:Where would the Glaive be without its hero?
Dialogue: Where would the Glaive be without its hero?

Original: Crowe:Can you not talk like this while we're drinking, please? Besides, we just sent the Niffs running with their tails between their legs, right?
Dialogue: Can you not talk like this while we're drinking, please? Besides, we just sent the Niffs running with their tails between their legs, right?

Original: Luche:They weren't running from us. No, they were toying with us.
Dialogue: They weren't running from us. No, they were toying with us.

Original: Nyx:Stop being such a buzzkill, Luche. We all know what happened.
Dialogue: Stop being such a buzzkill, Luche. We all know what happened.

Original: Luche:Well, did you know they sent an envoy to the Citadel after that?
Dialogue: Well, did you know they sent an envoy to the Citadel after that?

Original: Libertus:What for? To offer their surrender?
Dialogue: What for? To offer their surrender?

Original: Luche:More like demand ours.
Dialogue: More like demand ours.

Original: Libertus:"Demand?" My ass!
Dialogue: "Demand?" My ass!

Original: Luche:No? Think about it. The Empire's got Lucis on its last legs. It's the perfect time to make demands.
Dialogue: No? Think about it. The Empire's got Lucis on its last legs. It's the perfect time to make demands.

Original: Council Member 1:We are losing this war, Your Majesty. Lucis cannot rely on the Kingsglaive alone. Accepting the truce may be our best course of action.
Dialogue: We are losing this war, Your Majesty. Lucis cannot rely on the Kingsglaive alone. Accepting the truce may be our best course of action.

Original: Council Member 2:You speak of matters beyond the New Wall. We have no need of a truce here, so long as it stands. And, if our position worsens, we still have the Old Wall.
Dialogue: You speak of matters beyond the New Wall. We have no need of a truce here, so long as it stands. And, if our position worsens, we still have the Old Wall.

Original: Council Member 3:Yes, but this truce will end the fighting altogether. If only we could compromise--
Dialogue: Yes, but this truce will end the fighting altogether. If only we could compromise--

Original: Clarus:Compromise is unwise. We know nothing of Niflheim's true intentions. Do not fool yourselves, The Walls are far from impenetrable.
Dialogue: Compromise is unwise. We know nothing of Niflheim's true intentions. Do not fool yourselves, The Walls are far from impenetrable.

Original: Clarus:Then let the choice be made, Your Majesty. What are we to protect?
Dialogue: Then let the choice be made, Your Majesty. What are we to protect?

Original: Girl's Voice:(memory)Help, mother!
Dialogue: (memory)Help, mother!

Original: Libertus:How come you never lose your lunch like that? Just doesn't add up. Here's this ancient art, secret of the royal family and all that.
Dialogue: How come you never lose your lunch like that? Just doesn't add up. Here's this ancient art, secret of the royal family and all that.

Original: Crowe:Libertus! Nyx! Come here, guys, you gotta see this.
Dialogue: Libertus! Nyx! Come here, guys, you gotta see this.

Original: News Anchor:(on TV)Things were hectic in the capital today as the Lucian government announced full acceptance of what some are criticizing as the unilateral peace terms proposed by Chancellor Izunia of Niflheim. The signing of the truce will see governing power over all Lucian territories transferred to the Empire, with the sole exception of Insomnia. In return, Niflheim guarantees the continued safety of Insomnia and its citizenry, as well as a cessation to all hostilities, bringing a decisive end to this long and bitter war.
Dialogue: (on TV)Things were hectic in the capital today as the Lucian government announced full acceptance of what some are criticizing as the unilateral peace terms proposed by Chancellor Izunia of Niflheim. The signing of the truce will see governing power over all Lucian territories transferred to the Empire, with the sole exception of Insomnia. In return, Niflheim guarantees the continued safety of Insomnia and its citizenry, as well as a cessation to all hostilities, bringing a decisive end to this long and bitter war.

Original: Crowe:All that fighting we did. All for nothing.
Dialogue: All that fighting we did. All for nothing.

Original: Captain Drautos:Glaives. Assemble in the briefing room.Now.
Dialogue: Glaives. Assemble in the briefing room.Now.

Original: Captain Drautos:The king has spoken, and you have heard. All lands beyond the Wall are to be relinquished to the Empire.
Dialogue: The king has spoken, and you have heard. All lands beyond the Wall are to be relinquished to the Empire.

Original: Luche:Will no regions be spared?
Dialogue: Will no regions be spared?

Original: Libertus:But your home's out there, too!
Dialogue: But your home's out there, too!

Original: Captain Drautos:It is.
Dialogue: It is.

Original: Libertus:Why would the king do this?
Dialogue: Why would the king do this?

Original: Captain Drautos:Because it'll end this damn war. Crowe.
Dialogue: Because it'll end this damn war. Crowe.

Original: Captain Drautos:Prepare to deploy. You're being sent to infiltrate Tenebrae.
Dialogue: Prepare to deploy. You're being sent to infiltrate Tenebrae.

Original: Crowe:Tenebrae, sir?
Dialogue: Tenebrae, sir?

Original: Captain Drautos:Mission details are classified. Report to my office for briefing in thirty minutes. And, Nyx: you're off the West Gate. You've been reassigned to the castle guard. That is all.
Dialogue: Mission details are classified. Report to my office for briefing in thirty minutes. And, Nyx you're off the West Gate. You've been reassigned to the castle guard. That is all.

Original: Libertus:So, this is what you were talking about, Luche?
Dialogue: So, this is what you were talking about, Luche?

Original: Luche:You heard the captain. This wasn't our decision to make.
Dialogue: You heard the captain. This wasn't our decision to make.

Original: Libertus:Not ours to make? Those are our homes out there! Our people! And you're just gonna go along with this and abandon them?
Dialogue: Not ours to make? Those are our homes out there! Our people! And you're just gonna go along with this and abandon them?

Original: Luche:If we don't go along with them, the Empire will unleash all hell on Insomnia.
Dialogue: If we don't go along with them, the Empire will unleash all hell on Insomnia.

Original: Libertus:We'll unleash it right back at them!
Dialogue: We'll unleash it right back at them!

Original: Nyx:Easy, easy. He's not the enemy.
Dialogue: Easy, easy. He's not the enemy.

Original: Tredd:Don't you get it? We're nothing to them. Rats, snuck in from beyond the Wall. Sure, they had a use for us when they realized we could work their magic. So they handpicked us out from all the other rats out there and just let us nibble away at His Royal Majesty's precious power. But, as soon as this war's all over, it's back to the sewers for all of us. That means you too, hero. You missing home so much, Libertus, why don't you and Nyx head on back? I'm sure Niflheim will welcome you with open arms.
Dialogue: Don't you get it? We're nothing to them. Rats, snuck in from beyond the Wall. Sure, they had a use for us when they realized we could work their magic. So they handpicked us out from all the other rats out there and just let us nibble away at His Royal Majesty's precious power. But, as soon as this war's all over, it's back to the sewers for all of us. That means you too, hero. You missing home so much, Libertus, why don't you and Nyx head on back? I'm sure Niflheim will welcome you with open arms.

Original: Nyx:You've got a home out there, too! Or did you forget?
Dialogue: You've got a home out there, too! Or did you forget?

Original: Libertus:Ugh! Damn it! I'm not gonna let it end like this!
Dialogue: Ugh! Damn it! I'm not gonna let it end like this!

Original: Council Member 1:It is said sentiment amongst the people is favorable, Your Majesty. Most all will welcome this peace.
Dialogue: It is said sentiment amongst the people is favorable, Your Majesty. Most all will welcome this peace.

Original: King Regis:If you yourself have not heard their voices, how can you claim to know their hearts?
Dialogue: If you yourself have not heard their voices, how can you claim to know their hearts?

Original: Council Member 2:What of the mission to Tenebrae, Your Majesty? Is such clandestine action wise? If discovered, it will only serve to provoke the Empire.
Dialogue: What of the mission to Tenebrae, Your Majesty? Is such clandestine action wise? If discovered, it will only serve to provoke the Empire.

Original: Clarus:The Empire remains our enemy until the treaty is signed. So long as we are at war, His Majesty intends to remain one step ahead of them.
Dialogue: The Empire remains our enemy until the treaty is signed. So long as we are at war, His Majesty intends to remain one step ahead of them.

Original: Council Member 2:Of course.
Dialogue: Of course.

Original: Nyx:A hairpin? I didn't think you were into that kind of thing.
Dialogue: A hairpin? I didn't think you were into that kind of thing.

Original: Crowe:It's not for me, it's a gift for the princess. But keep that quiet, nobody's supposed to know.
Dialogue: It's not for me, it's a gift for the princess. But keep that quiet, nobody's supposed to know.

Original: Crowe:Well, that's me.
Dialogue: Well, that's me.

Original: Nyx:Watch your back out there.
Dialogue: Watch your back out there.

Original: Libertus:I know you're sick of hearing it, but you're like a little--
Dialogue: I know you're sick of hearing it, but you're like a little--

Original: Crowe:(interrupting)Little sister to you. Yeah, I am sick of hearing it.
Dialogue: (interrupting)Little sister to you. Yeah, I am sick of hearing it.

Original: Libertus:Just make sure you come back in one piece, all right?
Dialogue: Just make sure you come back in one piece, all right?

Original: Crowe:Says the guy in two pieces.
Dialogue: Says the guy in two pieces.

Original: Maria:Lady Lunafreya, I have left the rear gate open.
Dialogue: Lady Lunafreya, I have left the rear gate open.

Original: Lunafreya:Thank you.
Dialogue: Thank you.

Original: Maria:Must you go?
Dialogue: Must you go?

Original: Maria:Then go quickly!
Dialogue: Then go quickly!

Original: Ravus:I do not recall granting you permission to leave your quarters, Lunafreya.
Dialogue: I do not recall granting you permission to leave your quarters, Lunafreya.

Original: Ravus:You are not to leave this room again until the journey to Lucis. It is for your own good.
Dialogue: You are not to leave this room again until the journey to Lucis. It is for your own good.

Original: Lunafreya:My own good? What is truly going on here? What cause does the Empire have to see me wed to Noctis?
Dialogue: My own good? What is truly going on here? What cause does the Empire have to see me wed to Noctis?

Original: Ravus:They have offered a peace, and your marriage is the olive branch.
Dialogue: They have offered a peace, and your marriage is the olive branch.

Original: Lunafreya:You expect me to believe that?
Dialogue: You expect me to believe that?

Original: Ravus:What you believe does not concern me. What does concern me is you sneaking off to go and tell our mother's killer about some plot you've dreamt up.
Dialogue: What you believe does not concern me. What does concern me is you sneaking off to go and tell our mother's killer about some plot you've dreamt up.

Original: Lunafreya:You are wrong to hate King Regis. Niflheim killed mother, not him. They murdered her and made you their lapdog.
Dialogue: You are wrong to hate King Regis. Niflheim killed mother, not him. They murdered her and made you their lapdog.

Original: Driver:It's done.
Dialogue: It's done.

Original: News Anchor:(on TV)An air of jubilation has swept the city in anticipation of the coming armistice. With only three days remaining until the peace is officially signed into effect, throngs of citizens have taken to the streets to show...
Dialogue: (on TV)An air of jubilation has swept the city in anticipation of the coming armistice. With only three days remaining until the peace is officially signed into effect, throngs of citizens have taken to the streets to show...

Original: King Regis:(memory)Lucis needs your strength, young warriors.
Dialogue: (memory)Lucis needs your strength, young warriors.

Original: Petra:(memory)We don't need any of you immigrants.
Dialogue: (memory)We don't need any of you immigrants.

Original: Captain Drautos:(memory)Whatever strength you have is on loan from the king. You are nothing without him.
Dialogue: (memory)Whatever strength you have is on loan from the king. You are nothing without him.

Original: Girl's Voice:(memory)Nyx, help mother!
Dialogue: (memory)Nyx, help mother!

Original: Young Nyx:(memory)Selena, get down!
Dialogue: (memory)Selena, get down!

Original: News Anchor:(on TV)...And the waves of Imperial diplomats entering the city.
Dialogue: (on TV)...And the waves of Imperial diplomats entering the city.

Original: King Regis:The princess? Are you certain?
Dialogue: The princess? Are you certain?

Original: Messenger:Yes, Your Majesty. She was amongst the last of the Imperial contingent to enter the city.
Dialogue: Yes, Your Majesty. She was amongst the last of the Imperial contingent to enter the city.

Original: Captain Drautos:Get in.
Dialogue: Get in.

Original: Nyx:I'm reporting to my post now though, sir.
Dialogue: I'm reporting to my post now though, sir.

Original: Captain Drautos:New orders. Come on, we've got a princess to pick up.
Dialogue: New orders. Come on, we've got a princess to pick up.

Original: Nyx:Nice ride, sir.
Dialogue: Nice ride, sir.

Original: Captain Drautos:It belongs to the prince. We've taken him outside the city.
Dialogue: It belongs to the prince. We've taken him outside the city.

Original: Nyx:Doesn't he have a wedding to plan, sir?
Dialogue: Doesn't he have a wedding to plan, sir?

Original: Captain Drautos:Cut the "sir" crap. The king has a plan of his own. Prince Noctis and Princess Lunafreya are to meet far from Insomnia.
Dialogue: Cut the "sir" crap. The king has a plan of his own. Prince Noctis and Princess Lunafreya are to meet far from Insomnia.

Original: Nyx:What's she doing here, then?
Dialogue: What's she doing here, then?

Original: Captain Drautos:Complicating things. We sent Crowe to find the princess and escort her out of Tenebrae. We're still trying to figure out what went wrong.
Dialogue: Complicating things. We sent Crowe to find the princess and escort her out of Tenebrae. We're still trying to figure out what went wrong.

Original: Captain Drautos:So, I know what you think about this war, but what do you think about this peace? You happy giving up your home?
Dialogue: So, I know what you think about this war, but what do you think about this peace? You happy giving up your home?

Original: Nyx:It's the king's decision. I owe him for taking me in. I was lucky. There are people in Galahd who weren't. And they need me.
Dialogue: It's the king's decision. I owe him for taking me in. I was lucky. There are people in Galahd who weren't. And they need me.

Original: Captain Drautos:So you're going back? What good will you be without the king's magic? Yeah, always wanting to save somebody. I get it, believe me. But it doesn't win wars.
Dialogue: So you're going back? What good will you be without the king's magic? Yeah, always wanting to save somebody. I get it, believe me. But it doesn't win wars.

Original: Nyx:It's not just wanting. It's not just me. Libertus is the one you need to worry about. He'll go back if things get worse.
Dialogue: It's not just wanting. It's not just me. Libertus is the one you need to worry about. He'll go back if things get worse.

Original: Captain Drautos:The worst is yet to come.
Dialogue: The worst is yet to come.

Original: Escort:Do you have any idea who you're stopping? Open this gate now, and maybe you'll have a job tomorrow.
Dialogue: Do you have any idea who you're stopping? Open this gate now, and maybe you'll have a job tomorrow.

Original: Petra:King's orders.
Dialogue: King's orders.

Original: Escort:Are you sure you want to risk a diplomatic issue now, of all times? I am the personal escort of Lady Lunafreya Nox Fleuret, Princess of the former Tenebrae and the Or--
Dialogue: Are you sure you want to risk a diplomatic issue now, of all times? I am the personal escort of Lady Lunafreya Nox Fleuret, Princess of the former Tenebrae and the Or--

Original: Captain Drautos:(interrupting)And our kingdom's beloved bride-to-be. Welcome to sovereign jurisdiction, Ambassador. We'll take care of things from here.
Dialogue: (interrupting)And our kingdom's beloved bride-to-be. Welcome to sovereign jurisdiction, Ambassador. We'll take care of things from here.

Original: Diplomat:Forgive me, Captain Drautos.
Dialogue: Forgive me, Captain Drautos.

Original: Captain Drautos:(crosstalk, to Nyx)See Her Highness to the castle.
Dialogue: (crosstalk, to Nyx)See Her Highness to the castle.

Original: Diplomat:(crosstalk)I had no idea that you-- I wasn't made aware of any--
Dialogue: (crosstalk)I had no idea that you-- I wasn't made aware of any--

Original: Nyx:Excuse me. Thank you.
Dialogue: Excuse me. Thank you.

Original: Diplomat:(crosstalk)No, you-- I must-- I must-- no, I have to clear it with my superiors first.
Dialogue: (crosstalk)No, you-- I must-- I must-- no, I have to clear it with my superiors first.

Original: Nyx:(to Lunafreya)Your Highness.
Dialogue: (to Lunafreya)Your Highness.

Original: Messenger:Her Royal Highness, Princess Lunafreya of Tenebrae.
Dialogue: Her Royal Highness, Princess Lunafreya of Tenebrae.

Original: Lunafreya:It has been a long time, Your Majesty.
Dialogue: It has been a long time, Your Majesty.

Original: King Regis:Yes. Far too long.
Dialogue: Yes. Far too long.

Original: Lunafreya:Prince Noctis isn't here, is he?
Dialogue: Prince Noctis isn't here, is he?

Original: King Regis:No, my dear. He is not. I am too old to fight this war. I have no choice but to receive the Empire and accept their treaty. Even so...I had hoped to hold the wedding elsewhere, somewhere safe. I sent one of my Glaive to see you there, but--
Dialogue: No, my dear. He is not. I am too old to fight this war. I have no choice but to receive the Empire and accept their treaty. Even so...I had hoped to hold the wedding elsewhere, somewhere safe. I sent one of my Glaive to see you there, but--

Original: King Regis:It is not too late. I can ready an escort. Please, go to my son.
Dialogue: It is not too late. I can ready an escort. Please, go to my son.

Original: Lunafreya:No. Wherever I go, the Empire will follow. It would only place the prince in greater danger. It is my duty to protect the prince and see his destiny fulfilled. These twelve years have not changed that.
Dialogue: No. Wherever I go, the Empire will follow. It would only place the prince in greater danger. It is my duty to protect the prince and see his destiny fulfilled. These twelve years have not changed that.

Original: King Regis:And what of your destiny?
Dialogue: And what of your destiny?

Original: Lunafreya:My duty is my destiny, Your Majesty. I'm prepared to accept whatever may come to pass.
Dialogue: My duty is my destiny, Your Majesty. I'm prepared to accept whatever may come to pass.

Original: Man 1:So, what do you think? All these lands will be imperial soon. Reckon things will get better when them Niffs start calling the shots?
Dialogue: So, what do you think? All these lands will be imperial soon. Reckon things will get better when them Niffs start calling the shots?

Original: Man 2:Not one damn bit. Don't matter who's calling the shots: as long as they're calling them from behind the Wall, ain't nothing gonna change around here.
Dialogue: Not one damn bit. Don't matter who's calling the shots as long as they're calling them from behind the Wall, ain't nothing gonna change around here.

Original: Man 2:(off-screen)Get over here!
Dialogue: (off-screen)Get over here!

Original: Man 2:That's a hand!
Dialogue: That's a hand!

Original: Captain Drautos:I trust the reunion was a happy one?
Dialogue: I trust the reunion was a happy one?

Original: Nyx:Has she been a hostage of Niflheim all this time?
Dialogue: Has she been a hostage of Niflheim all this time?

Original: Captain Drautos:She's a symbol of the peace, that's all I'm told.
Dialogue: She's a symbol of the peace, that's all I'm told.

Original: Nyx:Doesn't sound like it. Sounds like she's here for something much bigger than that.
Dialogue: Doesn't sound like it. Sounds like she's here for something much bigger than that.

Original: Captain Drautos:Your orders are to protect her.
Dialogue: Your orders are to protect her.

Original: Captain Drautos:Not to look, not to listen, not to think. Understood?(answering)Drautos. Yes, report.
Dialogue: Not to look, not to listen, not to think. Understood?(answering)Drautos. Yes, report.

Original: Libertus:Get the hell out of my way! That's my friend you got in there, damn it!
Dialogue: Get the hell out of my way! That's my friend you got in there, damn it!

Original: Medic:Sir, you can't go in until the examination has ended.
Dialogue: Sir, you can't go in until the examination has ended.

Original: Libertus:What examination? What the hell's going on?
Dialogue: What examination? What the hell's going on?

Original: Nyx:Hey! Hey, take it easy, big guy.
Dialogue: Hey! Hey, take it easy, big guy.

Original: Libertus:These bastards rushed Crowe in there the moment she got back. And now they won't let me in to see her.
Dialogue: These bastards rushed Crowe in there the moment she got back. And now they won't let me in to see her.

Original: Captain Drautos:Crowe's personal effects. Do with them as you see fit.
Dialogue: Crowe's personal effects. Do with them as you see fit.

Original: Libertus:So, what kind of mission did you really send her on? No Glaive winds up dead on a standard escort.
Dialogue: So, what kind of mission did you really send her on? No Glaive winds up dead on a standard escort.

Original: Captain Drautos:I'll see the armistice does not interfere with a full investigation. She was a good soldier, her death will not go unanswered.
Dialogue: I'll see the armistice does not interfere with a full investigation. She was a good soldier, her death will not go unanswered.

Original: Libertus:What a life, huh? She was brought up an orphan. Run out of her village. I still remember the first time I saw her. Scrawny little thing, all covered in dirt. Not a friend in the world. But those eyes...damn. There was something about those eyes. She deserved better. And I would've done anything to give it to--
Dialogue: What a life, huh? She was brought up an orphan. Run out of her village. I still remember the first time I saw her. Scrawny little thing, all covered in dirt. Not a friend in the world. But those eyes...damn. There was something about those eyes. She deserved better. And I would've done anything to give it to--

Original: Nyx:Libertus, wait. Crowe died a Glaive. You can still honor her by fighting as one.
Dialogue: Libertus, wait. Crowe died a Glaive. You can still honor her by fighting as one.

Original: Libertus:You're dumber than me sometimes, you know that? Don't you get it? Lucis killed Crowe. Go back to the castle! Tell the king there's no peace to be had from throwing the weak to the wolves. I'll fight my own fight from here on out. See you around, hero.
Dialogue: You're dumber than me sometimes, you know that? Don't you get it? Lucis killed Crowe. Go back to the castle! Tell the king there's no peace to be had from throwing the weak to the wolves. I'll fight my own fight from here on out. See you around, hero.

Original: Nyx:(memory)A hairpin? I didn't think you were into that kind of thing.
Dialogue: (memory)A hairpin? I didn't think you were into that kind of thing.

Original: Crowe:(memory)It's not for me. It's a gift for the princess.
Dialogue: (memory)It's not for me. It's a gift for the princess.

Original: Emperor Aldercapt:A most grand reception, King Regis. You honor all of Niflheim.
Dialogue: A most grand reception, King Regis. You honor all of Niflheim.

Original: King Regis:Oh, the honor is ours, Emperor Aldercapt. You have ventured far to grace us with your presence.
Dialogue: Oh, the honor is ours, Emperor Aldercapt. You have ventured far to grace us with your presence.

Original: Emperor Aldercapt:It was the very least I could do. Tomorrow will be an historic day for both our nations. And your Insomnia is truly a marvel. My own cities pale in comparison. I pray we are able to take away much...from this visit.
Dialogue: It was the very least I could do. Tomorrow will be an historic day for both our nations. And your Insomnia is truly a marvel. My own cities pale in comparison. I pray we are able to take away much...from this visit.

Original: Lunafreya:Hello. I'm afraid we were never properly introduced yesterday.
Dialogue: Hello. I'm afraid we were never properly introduced yesterday.

Original: Nyx:I'm afraid it's going to have to wait, Your Highness. I'm on guard duty.
Dialogue: I'm afraid it's going to have to wait, Your Highness. I'm on guard duty.

Original: Lunafreya:Then surely there's no safer place for me to be. May I ask your name?
Dialogue: Then surely there's no safer place for me to be. May I ask your name?

Original: Nyx:Uh, Nyx. Nyx Ulric.
Dialogue: Uh, Nyx. Nyx Ulric.

Original: Lunafreya:There is something else I wish to ask you, Nyx Ulric. King Regis said he sent one of your order to come find me. I should like to offer my thanks in person. Where might I find this brave soldier?
Dialogue: There is something else I wish to ask you, Nyx Ulric. King Regis said he sent one of your order to come find me. I should like to offer my thanks in person. Where might I find this brave soldier?

Original: Lunafreya:Oh. Oh, I did not--I am so sorry.
Dialogue: Oh. Oh, I did not--I am so sorry.

Original: Nyx:Don't be.
Dialogue: Don't be.

Original: Nyx:Here. She was carrying this. It was meant for you.
Dialogue: Here. She was carrying this. It was meant for you.

Original: Lunafreya:For me?
Dialogue: For me?

Original: Nyx:Keep it. She would've wanted you to have it.
Dialogue: Keep it. She would've wanted you to have it.

Original: Lunafreya:I will carry it with me always. Thank you.
Dialogue: I will carry it with me always. Thank you.

Original: Pruvia:Do you have any idea what this peace means? It means our homes are gone. All of them. Forever.
Dialogue: Do you have any idea what this peace means? It means our homes are gone. All of them. Forever.

Original: Libertus:Heard I could find some treaty haters here. I come to the right place?
Dialogue: Heard I could find some treaty haters here. I come to the right place?

Original: Pruvia:You certainly have. Everyone say hello to a man who spends his days in the loyal service of our good king.
Dialogue: You certainly have. Everyone say hello to a man who spends his days in the loyal service of our good king.

Original: Libertus:"Spent." Those days are over. I'm done listening to that bastard's lies. He may sit on a throne, but he ain't no king, least not of mine.
Dialogue: "Spent." Those days are over. I'm done listening to that bastard's lies. He may sit on a throne, but he ain't no king, least not of mine.

Original: Pruvia:Well, then. Welcome to the resistance, brother. I hope you're here to talk.
Dialogue: Well, then. Welcome to the resistance, brother. I hope you're here to talk.

Original: Libertus:What do you wanna know?
Dialogue: What do you wanna know?

Original: Lunafreya:Please, wherever Noctis is, keep him safe. That's all I ask.
Dialogue: Please, wherever Noctis is, keep him safe. That's all I ask.

Original: General Glauca:To what god do you pray? You, the slave of fate and destiny. Abandon your prayers - the gods do not listen.
Dialogue: To what god do you pray? You, the slave of fate and destiny. Abandon your prayers - the gods do not listen.

Original: Lunafreya:General Glauca. Why are you here?
Dialogue: General Glauca. Why are you here?

Original: General Glauca:You are far too clever to have ever believed in this peace. Pity you couldn't see your beloved Noctis. You have another purpose.
Dialogue: You are far too clever to have ever believed in this peace. Pity you couldn't see your beloved Noctis. You have another purpose.

Original: Lunafreya:I'm not here for Niflheim.
Dialogue: I'm not here for Niflheim.

Original: General Glauca:No. You are here for me.
Dialogue: No. You are here for me.

Original: Lunafreya:You? I do not understand.
Dialogue: You? I do not understand.

Original: General Glauca:Come tomorrow, you will.
Dialogue: Come tomorrow, you will.

Original: Man:(over intercom)Niflheim contingent has left the hotel. Less than three hours until the ceremony. Bolster the Citadel guard.
Dialogue: (over intercom)Niflheim contingent has left the hotel. Less than three hours until the ceremony. Bolster the Citadel guard.

Original: Pelna:(over radio)Nyx, is the princess with you?
Dialogue: (over radio)Nyx, is the princess with you?

Original: Nyx:No, I'm on duty at the Citadel.
Dialogue: No, I'm on duty at the Citadel.

Original: Pelna:(over radio)Well, the Niffs just left for the ceremony, and she wasn't with them.
Dialogue: (over radio)Well, the Niffs just left for the ceremony, and she wasn't with them.

Original: Pelna:(over radio)A homing beacon?
Dialogue: (over radio)A homing beacon?

Original: Nyx:Yeah, I'll send the coordinates now. Can you pinpoint a location for me?
Dialogue: Yeah, I'll send the coordinates now. Can you pinpoint a location for me?

Original: Pelna:(over radio)Sure, but it sounds like a wild-goose chase. Guess you got some free time on your hands, huh?
Dialogue: (over radio)Sure, but it sounds like a wild-goose chase. Guess you got some free time on your hands, huh?

Original: Nyx:Guess I do, for better or worse.
Dialogue: Guess I do, for better or worse.

Original: Pelna:(over radio)Those coordinates are about twenty miles south of Insomnia.
Dialogue: (over radio)Those coordinates are about twenty miles south of Insomnia.

Original: Nyx:Outside the Wall.
Dialogue: Outside the Wall.

Original: Pelna:(over radio)What the hell was Crowe doing all the way out there?
Dialogue: (over radio)What the hell was Crowe doing all the way out there?

Original: Nyx:No, no. They sent her to-- I need another favor, Pelna. Pull those coordinates up on the radar and let me know what you find.
Dialogue: No, no. They sent her to-- I need another favor, Pelna. Pull those coordinates up on the radar and let me know what you find.

Original: Pelna:(over radio)On it. You're thinking this is all a big deal now, huh?
Dialogue: (over radio)On it. You're thinking this is all a big deal now, huh?

Original: Nyx:Yeah, too big to ignore.
Dialogue: Yeah, too big to ignore.

Original: Guard 1:(cross-talk)Whoa, whoa, whoa, whoa! Excuse me, sir. Excuse me!
Dialogue: (cross-talk)Whoa, whoa, whoa, whoa! Excuse me, sir. Excuse me!

Original: Guard 2:(cross-talk)Hey, hey, hey!
Dialogue: (cross-talk)Hey, hey, hey!

Original: Guard 3:(cross-talk)Whoa, wait a minute! Stop right there!
Dialogue: (cross-talk)Whoa, wait a minute! Stop right there!

Original: Petra:Listen up. This is not the gate watch. This is the heart of our city, the home of our king. The ceremony must not be disturbed. Neutralize any threat quickly and quietly. Is that understood?
Dialogue: Listen up. This is not the gate watch. This is the heart of our city, the home of our king. The ceremony must not be disturbed. Neutralize any threat quickly and quietly. Is that understood?

Original: Crownsguard:(together)Yes, sir!
Dialogue: (together)Yes, sir!

Original: Nyx:Glaive to command. Are you there, captain? Urgent. Damn it, Drautos!
Dialogue: Glaive to command. Are you there, captain? Urgent. Damn it, Drautos!

Original: Pelna:(over radio)Jackpot, Nyx. There's a whole fleet of airships sitting at that spot.
Dialogue: (over radio)Jackpot, Nyx. There's a whole fleet of airships sitting at that spot.

Original: Pelna:(over radio)Yup, and, from the looks of it, I'd say they're headed to war.
Dialogue: (over radio)Yup, and, from the looks of it, I'd say they're headed to war.

Original: Nyx:Where's the captain?
Dialogue: Where's the captain?

Original: Pelna:(over radio)Should be at the Citadel.
Dialogue: (over radio)Should be at the Citadel.

Original: Nyx:There's no answer on his frequency.
Dialogue: There's no answer on his frequency.

Original: Pelna:(over radio)I don't know, must have his hands full with the escort detail.
Dialogue: (over radio)I don't know, must have his hands full with the escort detail.

Original: Nyx:Pelna, one last favor. I need you to prep the Glaive for action.
Dialogue: Pelna, one last favor. I need you to prep the Glaive for action.

Original: Pelna:(over radio)What- what are you talking about? You wanna deploy without the captain's order?
Dialogue: (over radio)What- what are you talking about? You wanna deploy without the captain's order?

Original: Nyx:Trust me. Just get it done.
Dialogue: Trust me. Just get it done.

Original: Pelna:(over radio)Wait, what am I supposed to tell--?
Dialogue: (over radio)Wait, what am I supposed to tell--?

Original: Crownsguard:Stand down, Glaive.
Dialogue: Stand down, Glaive.

Original: Clarus:The ceremony is in less than two hours. We must make ready.
Dialogue: The ceremony is in less than two hours. We must make ready.

Original: King Regis:Very well.
Dialogue: Very well.

Original: Messenger:Your Majesty. A man of the Kingsglaive is here, sire. He demands an audience.
Dialogue: Your Majesty. A man of the Kingsglaive is here, sire. He demands an audience.

Original: Nyx:Your Majesty, please.
Dialogue: Your Majesty, please.

Original: Nyx:Give the order to deploy the Glaive.
Dialogue: Give the order to deploy the Glaive.

Original: Nyx:A Niflheim fleet makes ready for war twenty miles to the south.
Dialogue: A Niflheim fleet makes ready for war twenty miles to the south.

Original: Clarus:An imperial fleet.
Dialogue: An imperial fleet.

Original: Nyx:And they have the princess.
Dialogue: And they have the princess.

Original: King Regis:Clarus, post guards outside the treaty room.
Dialogue: Clarus, post guards outside the treaty room.

Original: Clarus:It will be seen as a lack of faith in the peace.
Dialogue: It will be seen as a lack of faith in the peace.

Original: King Regis:Which we all harbor. See it done. We may well have to take Emperor Aldercapt into custody.
Dialogue: Which we all harbor. See it done. We may well have to take Emperor Aldercapt into custody.

Original: Clarus:Detain him? That would go beyond a new declaration of war.
Dialogue: Detain him? That would go beyond a new declaration of war.

Original: King Regis:We are still at war, Clarus. And you, Nyx Ulric. How soon can the Kingsglaive deploy?
Dialogue: We are still at war, Clarus. And you, Nyx Ulric. How soon can the Kingsglaive deploy?

Original: Nyx:On your word, at once.
Dialogue: On your word, at once.

Original: King Regis:Go, then! Save Luna.
Dialogue: Go, then! Save Luna.

Original: Glaive:What if this is a diversion?
Dialogue: What if this is a diversion?

Original: Nyx:Not likely. Tenebrae's princess is on board. We've got two jobs: save her, and stop those Niff ships from flying on Insomnia.
Dialogue: Not likely. Tenebrae's princess is on board. We've got two jobs save her, and stop those Niff ships from flying on Insomnia.

Original: Luche:We go in teams. Standard infiltrate and extract. Nyx, you command. We'll follow. The Glaive stands together, captain or no. For hearth.
Dialogue: We go in teams. Standard infiltrate and extract. Nyx, you command. We'll follow. The Glaive stands together, captain or no. For hearth.

Original: Kingsglaive:(together)And home!
Dialogue: (together)And home!

Original: News Anchor:(on TV)We are less than twenty minutes away from the signing of this historic treaty.
Dialogue: (on TV)We are less than twenty minutes away from the signing of this historic treaty.

Original: Captain Drautos:(over radio)I received word of the king's order to deploy. I'll see to matters in the city. You have your mission, and it won't be easy. The objective is two-fold: secure the hostage, and stay the enemy advance. Just be careful. One Glaive already died for this princess. Niflheim won't give her up easily.
Dialogue: (over radio)I received word of the king's order to deploy. I'll see to matters in the city. You have your mission, and it won't be easy. The objective is two-fold secure the hostage, and stay the enemy advance. Just be careful. One Glaive already died for this princess. Niflheim won't give her up easily.

Original: Nyx:(over radio)Team two.
Dialogue: (over radio)Team two.

Original: Pelna:(over radio)Oh, man. Hurry up, Nyx!
Dialogue: (over radio)Oh, man. Hurry up, Nyx!

Original: Pelna:Over here!
Dialogue: Over here!

Original: Nyx:(into earpiece)Preparing to head below deck.
Dialogue: (into earpiece)Preparing to head below deck.

Original: Captain Drautos:(over radio)Do not engage the enemy until instructed. The ceremony is underway. Let's wait and see how Niflheim plays this.
Dialogue: (over radio)Do not engage the enemy until instructed. The ceremony is underway. Let's wait and see how Niflheim plays this.

Original: Man:The Kingsglaive have infiltrated the ships, so everything's going according to plan.
Dialogue: The Kingsglaive have infiltrated the ships, so everything's going according to plan.

Original: Nyx:Ulric reporting. Six Niflheim airships confirmed inbound for Insomnia.
Dialogue: Ulric reporting. Six Niflheim airships confirmed inbound for Insomnia.

Original: Pelna:(into earpiece)Nyx, this doesn't feel like a war fleet.
Dialogue: (into earpiece)Nyx, this doesn't feel like a war fleet.

Original: Pelna:(into earpiece)I think I might've found her. I got a guarded door here. Two Niff MTs. What's the plan?
Dialogue: (into earpiece)I think I might've found her. I got a guarded door here. Two Niff MTs. What's the plan?

Original: Nyx:(into earpiece)Hold position.(to Drautos)Arrived at destination. High possibility of target in the vicinity.
Dialogue: (into earpiece)Hold position.(to Drautos)Arrived at destination. High possibility of target in the vicinity.

Original: Captain Drautos:(over radio)Proceed to secure.
Dialogue: (over radio)Proceed to secure.

Original: Nyx:(into earpiece)It's going to mean a fight.
Dialogue: (into earpiece)It's going to mean a fight.

Original: Captain Drautos:(over radio)Keep it quiet and keep it confined.
Dialogue: (over radio)Keep it quiet and keep it confined.

Original: Nyx:(into earpiece)Pelna, you're clear to engage, but keep it quiet. I'm on my way.
Dialogue: (into earpiece)Pelna, you're clear to engage, but keep it quiet. I'm on my way.

Original: King Regis:Forgive my delay. A bit of unforeseen trouble.
Dialogue: Forgive my delay. A bit of unforeseen trouble.

Original: Emperor Aldercapt:Nothing too vexing, I hope.
Dialogue: Nothing too vexing, I hope.

Original: King Regis:A simple theft, nothing more.
Dialogue: A simple theft, nothing more.

Original: Emperor Aldercapt:A daring thief, to steal from the king. Perhaps magical walls and castle gates do not keep all things safe.
Dialogue: A daring thief, to steal from the king. Perhaps magical walls and castle gates do not keep all things safe.

Original: King Regis:Perhaps. But no matter. That which was taken will soon be returned.
Dialogue: Perhaps. But no matter. That which was taken will soon be returned.

Original: Emperor Aldercapt:Impressive. You are a paragon of kingly composure. But I must ask: how can you be so sure?
Dialogue: Impressive. You are a paragon of kingly composure. But I must ask how can you be so sure?

Original: King Regis:Because this thing is no mere trinket. It possesses a will all its own. Enough to break any thief's grasp.
Dialogue: Because this thing is no mere trinket. It possesses a will all its own. Enough to break any thief's grasp.

Original: Emperor Aldercapt:Hm. That sounds a very fine prize indeed...
Dialogue: Hm. That sounds a very fine prize indeed...

Original: Pelna:Not now, damn it.
Dialogue: Not now, damn it.

Original: Pelna:For me? Aw, you shouldn't have.(into earpiece)Target confirmed. She's unharmed.
Dialogue: For me? Aw, you shouldn't have.(into earpiece)Target confirmed. She's unharmed.

Original: Clarus:The Glaives have recovered the princess, Your Majesty.
Dialogue: The Glaives have recovered the princess, Your Majesty.

Original: Emperor Aldercapt:Have you found your thief?
Dialogue: Have you found your thief?

Original: King Regis:We have. And what was stolen remains intact.
Dialogue: We have. And what was stolen remains intact.

Original: Emperor Aldercapt:Joyous news. I am relieved to hear it.
Dialogue: Joyous news. I am relieved to hear it.

Original: King Regis:Tell me, how heavy a sentence does the crime of theft carry in your Empire?
Dialogue: Tell me, how heavy a sentence does the crime of theft carry in your Empire?

Original: Emperor Aldercapt:Among the heaviest. Although there is one exception.
Dialogue: Among the heaviest. Although there is one exception.

Original: Luche:Things are about to get ugly over here.
Dialogue: Things are about to get ugly over here.

Original: Nyx:Pelna, get out of there! It's a trap!
Dialogue: Pelna, get out of there! It's a trap!

Original: King Regis:What is that?
Dialogue: What is that?

Original: Emperor Aldercapt:A curious old law I still permit in the outlands: a thief who escapes his captor can no longer be held to account for his crime.
Dialogue: A curious old law I still permit in the outlands a thief who escapes his captor can no longer be held to account for his crime.

Original: King Regis:A warning to the victim? "Never show weakness, lest you forgo the hand of justice."
Dialogue: A warning to the victim? "Never show weakness, lest you forgo the hand of justice."

Original: Emperor Aldercapt:Oh, no, good king. Far from it.
Dialogue: Oh, no, good king. Far from it.

Original: News Anchor:(on TV)The treaty is now on the table. The countdown begins to this historical moment.
Dialogue: (on TV)The treaty is now on the table. The countdown begins to this historical moment.

Original: Emperor Aldercapt:It is a warning to the hand of justice itself never to loose its grip.
Dialogue: It is a warning to the hand of justice itself never to loose its grip.

Original: Petra:Unit one, secure the perimeter. Unit two, stand your ground!
Dialogue: Unit one, secure the perimeter. Unit two, stand your ground!

Original: Pelna:One Tenebrae princess, safe and--
Dialogue: One Tenebrae princess, safe and--

Original: Nyx:Come on!
Dialogue: Come on!

Original: Petra: The Crystal! They're after the Crystal!
Dialogue: The Crystal! They're after the Crystal!

Original: Glaive:There's something going on below deck. The ship's not going to make it to Insom--
Dialogue: There's something going on below deck. The ship's not going to make it to Insom--

Original: Nyx:What's going on?
Dialogue: What's going on?

Original: Captain Drautos:(over radio)Insomnia is under attack.
Dialogue: (over radio)Insomnia is under attack.

Original: Nyx:Who brought you here?
Dialogue: Who brought you here?

Original: Lunafreya:General Glauca.
Dialogue: General Glauca.

Original: Nyx:You were bait. Us coming here was all part of their plan.
Dialogue: You were bait. Us coming here was all part of their plan.

Original: Nyx:Target secured. Request permission to withdraw.
Dialogue: Target secured. Request permission to withdraw.

Original: Captain Drautos:(over radio)Granted. Get to--
Dialogue: (over radio)Granted. Get to--

Original: King Regis:The Crystal will not serve you.
Dialogue: The Crystal will not serve you.

Original: Emperor Aldercapt:Nor you once I take it from this accursed city.
Dialogue: Nor you once I take it from this accursed city.

Original: Ravus:(to himself)It's not the Crystal I'm here for.
Dialogue: (to himself)It's not the Crystal I'm here for.

Original: Lunafreya:The Wall. It's gone.
Dialogue: The Wall. It's gone.

Original: Nyx:Fall back, it's a trap!
Dialogue: Fall back, it's a trap!

Original: Nyx:What the hell is going on?
Dialogue: What the hell is going on?

Original: Glaive 2:What's got into you?
Dialogue: What's got into you?

Original: Clarus:Come, we must escape while we can.
Dialogue: Come, we must escape while we can.

Original: King Regis:No, Clarus. I fear escape is no longer an option.
Dialogue: No, Clarus. I fear escape is no longer an option.

Original: King Regis:General Glauca.
Dialogue: General Glauca.

Original: Nyx:Can you make it up? Can you stand?
Dialogue: Can you make it up? Can you stand?

Original: Nyx:What are you doing? You gotta be kidding me.
Dialogue: What are you doing? You gotta be kidding me.

Original: Nyx:They teach piloting back at the royal academy? Give me that.
Dialogue: They teach piloting back at the royal academy? Give me that.

Original: Clarus:It's been a long time since I fought at your side, old friend.
Dialogue: It's been a long time since I fought at your side, old friend.

Original: King Regis:Yes, but this time it is not your fight. If you wish to leave, go now.
Dialogue: Yes, but this time it is not your fight. If you wish to leave, go now.

Original: Clarus:And abandon my king? I think not. Besides, our magic is bound to you. If you fall, Lucis falls.
Dialogue: And abandon my king? I think not. Besides, our magic is bound to you. If you fall, Lucis falls.

Original: King Regis:Then let us once more into the fray, old friend.
Dialogue: Then let us once more into the fray, old friend.

Original: Lunafreya:You must take me back to King Regis.
Dialogue: You must take me back to King Regis.

Original: Nyx:Are you out of your mind? Insomnia's a war zone.
Dialogue: Are you out of your mind? Insomnia's a war zone.

Original: Lunafreya:I have a duty. I cannot neglect it.
Dialogue: I have a duty. I cannot neglect it.

Original: Nyx:Yeah, I heard all that before.
Dialogue: Yeah, I heard all that before.

Original: Lunafreya:Then you know we must hurry.
Dialogue: Then you know we must hurry.

Original: Nyx:Hurry to do what? Get yourself killed?
Dialogue: Hurry to do what? Get yourself killed?

Original: Lunafreya:I do not fear death.
Dialogue: I do not fear death.

Original: Nyx:Oh, enough with all this brave princess act! Just pray this thing will make the trip.
Dialogue: Oh, enough with all this brave princess act! Just pray this thing will make the trip.

Original: Chancellor Izunia:Well, I daresay everything has proceeded according to plan. No?
Dialogue: Well, I daresay everything has proceeded according to plan. No?

Original: Emperor Aldercapt:So it has. We have broken the Wall. All that remains is to break the city.
Dialogue: So it has. We have broken the Wall. All that remains is to break the city.

Original: Chancellor Izunia:Shall we take our leave, then? The sun will soon set. We need not be here to witness the terrors of the night.
Dialogue: Shall we take our leave, then? The sun will soon set. We need not be here to witness the terrors of the night.

Original: Lunafreya:The Crystal.(to Nyx)You're going too fast. We have to land.
Dialogue: The Crystal.(to Nyx)You're going too fast. We have to land.

Original: Nyx:Yeah, you're gonna have to give me a minute on that.
Dialogue: Yeah, you're gonna have to give me a minute on that.

Original: Lunafreya:There is no time. I will go on my own.
Dialogue: There is no time. I will go on my own.

Original: Nyx:What? You got wings underneath that dress? You can't use magic.
Dialogue: What? You got wings underneath that dress? You can't use magic.

Original: Lunafreya:Not all miracles are made by magic. I do not fear death. What I fear is doing nothing and losing everything.
Dialogue: Not all miracles are made by magic. I do not fear death. What I fear is doing nothing and losing everything.

Original: Nyx:Oh, come on!
Dialogue: Oh, come on!

Original: Nyx:You can thank magic for that miracle, Your Highness.
Dialogue: You can thank magic for that miracle, Your Highness.

Original: Pruvia:The reckoning is at hand. Dawn of a new age.
Dialogue: The reckoning is at hand. Dawn of a new age.

Original: King Regis:You have the Crystal. What more would you take from me?
Dialogue: You have the Crystal. What more would you take from me?

Original: Ravus:The Ring of the Lucii. I lost my mother, my country, my birthright. Niflheim was the only life left to me. But all of that was for this. The Ring belongs to me now.
Dialogue: The Ring of the Lucii. I lost my mother, my country, my birthright. Niflheim was the only life left to me. But all of that was for this. The Ring belongs to me now.

Original: Ravus:Hear me, Lucian kings of old, for I am Ravus Nox Fleuret, and none is more worthy of your power than I!
Dialogue: Hear me, Lucian kings of old, for I am Ravus Nox Fleuret, and none is more worthy of your power than I!

Original: Lunafreya:Look out!
Dialogue: Look out!

Original: King Regis:Quickly, through here.
Dialogue: Quickly, through here.

Original: Lunafreya:Your Majesty.
Dialogue: Your Majesty.

Original: Nyx:You knew this was coming--
Dialogue: You knew this was coming--

Original: Lunafreya:Yes. But it was the only way to draw their wrath from Noctis.
Dialogue: Yes. But it was the only way to draw their wrath from Noctis.

Original: Nyx:Is that the way of our king? Sacrifice Lucian sons to save his own?
Dialogue: Is that the way of our king? Sacrifice Lucian sons to save his own?

Original: Lunafreya:To save the world.
Dialogue: To save the world.

Original: King Regis:See Luna safely to Altissia. This is not an order from a king to his Glaive. This is a plea from one man to another. Please, Nyx Ulric, keep her safe. For the future of all.
Dialogue: See Luna safely to Altissia. This is not an order from a king to his Glaive. This is a plea from one man to another. Please, Nyx Ulric, keep her safe. For the future of all.

Original: Nyx:The future?
Dialogue: The future?

Original: King Regis:Here, take this. It is time it passed to another's keeping.
Dialogue: Here, take this. It is time it passed to another's keeping.

Original: Lunafreya:No, please. Stop!
Dialogue: No, please. Stop!

Original: Nyx:Get back!
Dialogue: Get back!

Original: Lunafreya:Please, don't leave us!
Dialogue: Please, don't leave us!

Original: King Regis:I know your mother would wish the same as me. That you and Noctis live happily. All those years captive because I failed you. Not again. Locked doors will seal your fate no longer.
Dialogue: I know your mother would wish the same as me. That you and Noctis live happily. All those years captive because I failed you. Not again. Locked doors will seal your fate no longer.

Original: Lunafreya:King Regis...
Dialogue: King Regis...

Original: King Regis:Our hope goes with you now, Nyx Ulric. Godspeed.
Dialogue: Our hope goes with you now, Nyx Ulric. Godspeed.

Original: General Glauca:Behold, the king of Lucis, who hoarded tranquility within his precious Walls. Where is your tranquility now, king? Here is your peace, by steel's swift descent.
Dialogue: Behold, the king of Lucis, who hoarded tranquility within his precious Walls. Where is your tranquility now, king? Here is your peace, by steel's swift descent.

Original: Lunafreya:No! We must get away from here. It is what your king wanted.
Dialogue: No! We must get away from here. It is what your king wanted.

Original: General Glauca:(over radio, as narration)Lady Lunafreya has escaped with the Ring. Find her at once. She is not to leave the city.
Dialogue: (over radio, as narration)Lady Lunafreya has escaped with the Ring. Find her at once. She is not to leave the city.

Original: Nyx:(into earpiece)Ulric to command. Come in, captain.
Dialogue: (into earpiece)Ulric to command. Come in, captain.

Original: News Anchor:(on TV)Footage of the perpetrators was captured by a nearby surveillance camera. Here are images of the six suspects. One has been identified as Galahdian refugee, Libertus Ostium, a former member of the Lucian Kingsglaive.
Dialogue: (on TV)Footage of the perpetrators was captured by a nearby surveillance camera. Here are images of the six suspects. One has been identified as Galahdian refugee, Libertus Ostium, a former member of the Lucian Kingsglaive.

Original: Libertus:Hey, come here. Come here. I got you, I got you. You're all right. You're okay.
Dialogue: Hey, come here. Come here. I got you, I got you. You're all right. You're okay.

Original: Pruvia:It's fine. We're free. We're free now.
Dialogue: It's fine. We're free. We're free now.

Original: Libertus:We're free? What do you mean, "we're free?"
Dialogue: We're free? What do you mean, "we're free?"

Original: Pruvia:The Empire. They promised. This district is ours. All the refugees. It's our new home.
Dialogue: The Empire. They promised. This district is ours. All the refugees. It's our new home.

Original: Libertus:The Empire? You went in with Niflheim?
Dialogue: The Empire? You went in with Niflheim?

Original: Pruvia:Here. Take this. Meet up with the others. You're the hero of our revolution, brother.
Dialogue: Here. Take this. Meet up with the others. You're the hero of our revolution, brother.

Original: Nyx:Damn it!
Dialogue: Damn it!

Original: Tredd:This guy just doesn't know when he's beat.
Dialogue: This guy just doesn't know when he's beat.

Original: Nyx:Can you drive?
Dialogue: Can you drive?

Original: Nyx:I'll be right back!
Dialogue: I'll be right back!

Original: Tredd:No warping for you this time, hero.
Dialogue: No warping for you this time, hero.

Original: Nyx:Give me the wheel. Go!
Dialogue: Give me the wheel. Go!

Original: Lunafreya:You are without your magic.
Dialogue: You are without your magic.

Original: Nyx:You noticed that, huh? It must have died with the king.
Dialogue: You noticed that, huh? It must have died with the king.

Original: Petra:(over intercom)You're making a mess of my city, Glaive. I thought I told you not to go playing hero. Leave the ship to me. Looks like you got a royal fare to see to.
Dialogue: (over intercom)You're making a mess of my city, Glaive. I thought I told you not to go playing hero. Leave the ship to me. Looks like you got a royal fare to see to.

Original: Nyx:Move it!
Dialogue: Move it!

Original: Nyx:Maybe not all miracles are made by magic.
Dialogue: Maybe not all miracles are made by magic.

Original: Nyx:Oh, great.
Dialogue: Oh, great.

Original: Nyx:What the hell did you do to piss these things off?
Dialogue: What the hell did you do to piss these things off?

Original: Lunafreya:It's not me they're after. It's the Ring.
Dialogue: It's not me they're after. It's the Ring.

Original: Nyx:What's so special about this Ring? Don't tell me the future's really riding on it.
Dialogue: What's so special about this Ring? Don't tell me the future's really riding on it.

Original: Lunafreya:He who wears the Ring communes with the Lucii and commands great power.
Dialogue: He who wears the Ring communes with the Lucii and commands great power.

Original: Nyx:What kind of power?
Dialogue: What kind of power?

Original: Lunafreya:A forbidden one. Sealed within the Ring long ago.
Dialogue: A forbidden one. Sealed within the Ring long ago.

Original: Nyx:The Old Wall. I thought that was just a bedtime story.
Dialogue: The Old Wall. I thought that was just a bedtime story.

Original: Lunafreya:I can assure you it is not. But the Lucii grant their power only to those they deem worthy.
Dialogue: I can assure you it is not. But the Lucii grant their power only to those they deem worthy.

Original: Nyx:So, that guy who tried it on back there, I guess he wasn't deemed worthy.
Dialogue: So, that guy who tried it on back there, I guess he wasn't deemed worthy.

Original: Lunafreya:That was my brother. These twelve years have changed Ravus. He is bound by the past and lost in his lust for power.
Dialogue: That was my brother. These twelve years have changed Ravus. He is bound by the past and lost in his lust for power.

Original: Nyx:How the hell did they find us?
Dialogue: How the hell did they find us?

Original: Nyx:Your hairpin, they're tracking it. Give it to me.
Dialogue: Your hairpin, they're tracking it. Give it to me.

Original: Nyx:I had a little sister once. She was killed when the Empire came. I couldn't save her. I was as helpless then as I am now. I couldn't show her the future she wanted.
Dialogue: I had a little sister once. She was killed when the Empire came. I couldn't save her. I was as helpless then as I am now. I couldn't show her the future she wanted.

Original: Lunafreya:True power is not something that is found by those who seek it. It is something that comes to those who deserve it. Your sister wanted you to see a future as well. Anyone would wish the same for family they love.
Dialogue: True power is not something that is found by those who seek it. It is something that comes to those who deserve it. Your sister wanted you to see a future as well. Anyone would wish the same for family they love.

Original: Nyx:You don't pull any punches, do you?
Dialogue: You don't pull any punches, do you?

Original: Nyx:I'm over here!
Dialogue: I'm over here!

Original: Captain Drautos:(over radio)Do you hear me? Repeat, this is Drautos. Can you hear me? Over.
Dialogue: (over radio)Do you hear me? Repeat, this is Drautos. Can you hear me? Over.

Original: Nyx:Your timing's impeccable, captain. If the Lucii are real, they sure don't seem to mind their city getting torn apart.
Dialogue: Your timing's impeccable, captain. If the Lucii are real, they sure don't seem to mind their city getting torn apart.

Original: Captain Drautos:(over radio)You're to rendezvous and regroup. Understood?
Dialogue: (over radio)You're to rendezvous and regroup. Understood?

Original: Nyx:That might not be so easy, captain. My wings have been clipped, in case you didn't know.
Dialogue: That might not be so easy, captain. My wings have been clipped, in case you didn't know.

Original: Captain Drautos:(over radio)Ulric. Are you all right?
Dialogue: (over radio)Ulric. Are you all right?

Original: Nyx:I'm not dead, if that's what you mean, sir.
Dialogue: I'm not dead, if that's what you mean, sir.

Original: Captain Drautos:(over radio)Head for Section D as soon as you can. I'll have an evacuation team ready.
Dialogue: (over radio)Head for Section D as soon as you can. I'll have an evacuation team ready.

Original: Nyx:Don't suppose you could meet me at the gate. I'd kind of like to get the hell out of this city.
Dialogue: Don't suppose you could meet me at the gate. I'd kind of like to get the hell out of this city.

Original: Captain Drautos:(over radio)Imperials hold all exits, there's no way through. I'll meet you at Section D. Cut all radio contact until then. And make sure you get there.
Dialogue: (over radio)Imperials hold all exits, there's no way through. I'll meet you at Section D. Cut all radio contact until then. And make sure you get there.

Original: Nyx:It's a date, sir.
Dialogue: It's a date, sir.

Original: Libertus:Ain't no turning back now.
Dialogue: Ain't no turning back now.

Original: Man 1:(over radio)Status report.
Dialogue: (over radio)Status report.

Original: Man 2:(over radio)Ulric killed some good men.
Dialogue: (over radio)Ulric killed some good men.

Original: Man 1:(over radio)What about the Ring?
Dialogue: (over radio)What about the Ring?

Original: Man 2:(over radio)We don't have it yet.
Dialogue: (over radio)We don't have it yet.

Original: General Glauca:(over radio)This is Glauca. King Regis is dead. The Ring is on its way to Section D. We must recover the Ring to realize our goal.
Dialogue: (over radio)This is Glauca. King Regis is dead. The Ring is on its way to Section D. We must recover the Ring to realize our goal.

Original: General Glauca:(over radio)If Ulric or the princess get in the way, take them out. Reclaim our hearth and home.
Dialogue: (over radio)If Ulric or the princess get in the way, take them out. Reclaim our hearth and home.

Original: Libertus:"Hearth and home?"
Dialogue: "Hearth and home?"

Original: Man 3:(over walkie-talkie frequency)Libertus, come in. Where are you? Are you all right?
Dialogue: (over walkie-talkie frequency)Libertus, come in. Where are you? Are you all right?

Original: Libertus:I'm fine. On the way back to base now.
Dialogue: I'm fine. On the way back to base now.

Original: Man 3:(over radio)We need you to head to the junction in Section D. We're gonna join up with another unit and make a clean sweep of the place. We're one step away from realizing this revolution. Let's not let Pruvia's death be in vain. We'll be waiting for you, hero.
Dialogue: (over radio)We need you to head to the junction in Section D. We're gonna join up with another unit and make a clean sweep of the place. We're one step away from realizing this revolution. Let's not let Pruvia's death be in vain. We'll be waiting for you, hero.

Original: Nyx:Don't move until I say it's safe, all right?
Dialogue: Don't move until I say it's safe, all right?

Original: Lunafreya:I won't.
Dialogue: I won't.

Original: Nyx:Ulric, reporting! I have the princess! She's alive and well!
Dialogue: Ulric, reporting! I have the princess! She's alive and well!

Original: Nyx:Get out of here!
Dialogue: Get out of here!

Original: Luche:You've got some fight in you, Nyx, I'll give you that.
Dialogue: You've got some fight in you, Nyx, I'll give you that.

Original: Nyx:Run! Now!
Dialogue: Run! Now!

Original: Luche:I can't believe you're still moving with that hollow point in you. All Crowe could do was scream when one tore her insides apart.
Dialogue: I can't believe you're still moving with that hollow point in you. All Crowe could do was scream when one tore her insides apart.

Original: Nyx:Why'd you do it?
Dialogue: Why'd you do it?

Original: Luche:Because the Kingsglaive is nothing! An old man's battle fodder sent to die in Insomnia's war while our homes are bound and shackled.
Dialogue: Because the Kingsglaive is nothing! An old man's battle fodder sent to die in Insomnia's war while our homes are bound and shackled.

Original: Nyx:Niflheim took your home. Took all our homes! Nothing will ever change that.
Dialogue: Niflheim took your home. Took all our homes! Nothing will ever change that.

Original: Luche:You never were too smart. You could've had a new future with the Empire.
Dialogue: You never were too smart. You could've had a new future with the Empire.

Original: Luche:There's nowhere to run, princess. The Ring, give it to me.
Dialogue: There's nowhere to run, princess. The Ring, give it to me.

Original: Luche:So many dead over so simple a thing. But why? For what?
Dialogue: So many dead over so simple a thing. But why? For what?

Original: Lunafreya:Power. Untold power, beyond the control of someone like you.
Dialogue: Power. Untold power, beyond the control of someone like you.

Original: Nyx:Captain.
Dialogue: Captain.

Original: Drautos/Glauca:It's over. The daemons are unleashed, Lucis is fallen. Surrender the Ring.
Dialogue: It's over. The daemons are unleashed, Lucis is fallen. Surrender the Ring.

Original: Nyx:Plan on giving those kings a piece of your mind, princess? You got a destiny to take care of here, remember? Besides, didn't anyone tell you? I'm the hero around here.
Dialogue: Plan on giving those kings a piece of your mind, princess? You got a destiny to take care of here, remember? Besides, didn't anyone tell you? I'm the hero around here.

Original: Nyx:Show yourselves, kings of Lucis!
Dialogue: Show yourselves, kings of Lucis!

Original: Nyx:How long will you do nothing whilst Insomnia burns? Old or New, or whatever it is. Summon your Wall!
Dialogue: How long will you do nothing whilst Insomnia burns? Old or New, or whatever it is. Summon your Wall!

Original: The Mystic:It does not fall to us to guard your city. Man is a fool creature, clinging to his past and cowering from his future. Wasting his strength on bygone days.
Dialogue: It does not fall to us to guard your city. Man is a fool creature, clinging to his past and cowering from his future. Wasting his strength on bygone days.

Original: Nyx:And what future are you wards of?
Dialogue: And what future are you wards of?

Original: Oracle King:So short-sighted and cursed never to rise above it.
Dialogue: So short-sighted and cursed never to rise above it.

Original: King Regis:Wait. I have seen what this brave soul is prepared to do. He, too, seeks to safeguard the future.
Dialogue: Wait. I have seen what this brave soul is prepared to do. He, too, seeks to safeguard the future.

Original: Nyx:Your Majesty...
Dialogue: Your Majesty...

Original: The Mystic:Very well, young king. We will weigh your warrior's worth. But our boon does not come cheap. The cost is a life.
Dialogue: Very well, young king. We will weigh your warrior's worth. But our boon does not come cheap. The cost is a life.

Original: The Mystic: His...or hers.
Dialogue: His...or hers.

Original: Nyx:No. To hell with your power! I'm not here for it. I only came to tell you: you are no kings!
Dialogue: No. To hell with your power! I'm not here for it. I only came to tell you you are no kings!

Original: The Mystic:Your worth has been weighed and found wanting. Now burn!
Dialogue: Your worth has been weighed and found wanting. Now burn!

Original: Nyx:You're going to lose your precious Ring! But it's not too late to save it.
Dialogue: You're going to lose your precious Ring! But it's not too late to save it.

Original: The Oracle:You mean to barter for your life?
Dialogue: You mean to barter for your life?

Original: Nyx:No, no. My life is nothing. Giving a future to those who want to see it...is everything.
Dialogue: No, no. My life is nothing. Giving a future to those who want to see it...is everything.

Original: The Oracle:Hmm. You do not fear, even if that future is doomed.
Dialogue: Hmm. You do not fear, even if that future is doomed.

Original: The Mystic:And the price for it will be your life.
Dialogue: And the price for it will be your life.

Original: Nyx:You guys drive a hard bargain. Where do I sign?
Dialogue: You guys drive a hard bargain. Where do I sign?

Original: Nyx:I could get used to this.
Dialogue: I could get used to this.

Original: Libertus:Nyx...I'm sorry.
Dialogue: Nyx...I'm sorry.

Original: Nyx:Don't be. You saved me, now I owe you.
Dialogue: Don't be. You saved me, now I owe you.

Original: Libertus:For a change.
Dialogue: For a change.

Original: Nyx:I'm gonna need another favor. Meet Lunafreya Nox Fleuret, our prince's beloved bride-to-be. She has the future of the world in her hands. Keep her safe, get her out of Insomnia. Oh, I almost forgot. You'll need this.
Dialogue: I'm gonna need another favor. Meet Lunafreya Nox Fleuret, our prince's beloved bride-to-be. She has the future of the world in her hands. Keep her safe, get her out of Insomnia. Oh, I almost forgot. You'll need this.

Original: Nyx:Give Prince Noctis my regards. Libertus will take care of you from here. Have a safe journey, Your Highness.
Dialogue: Give Prince Noctis my regards. Libertus will take care of you from here. Have a safe journey, Your Highness.

Original: Lunafreya:What will come of you?
Dialogue: What will come of you?

Original: Libertus:What the hell are you doing?
Dialogue: What the hell are you doing?

Original: Nyx:Following the kings's orders.
Dialogue: Following the kings's orders.
