Original: Lunafreya:I will see the Ring to Noctis. The future will be safe, I swear it.
Dialogue: I will see the Ring to Noctis. The future will be safe, I swear it.

Original: Nyx:Planning on punching your way out of the city? Keep it. Now we're even.
Dialogue: Planning on punching your way out of the city? Keep it. Now we're even.

Original: Libertus:No. We'll settle up once you're back in Galahd. Me and everyone else will be waiting for you. I'm counting on you...hero.
Dialogue: No. We'll settle up once you're back in Galahd. Me and everyone else will be waiting for you. I'm counting on you...hero.

Original: Libertus:Buckle up, princess.
Dialogue: Buckle up, princess.

Original: Lunafreya:My life is in your hands.
Dialogue: My life is in your hands.

Original: Drautos/Glauca:So, the power of the Lucii returns. No matter. You are out of time.
Dialogue: So, the power of the Lucii returns. No matter. You are out of time.

Original: Nyx:For you, I'll make some.
Dialogue: For you, I'll make some.

Original: Drautos/Glauca:What can you hope to do? One man against an empire. Against the daemons. How will you save Insomnia with no Wall to protect you?
Dialogue: What can you hope to do? One man against an empire. Against the daemons. How will you save Insomnia with no Wall to protect you?

Original: Nyx:You've got it all wrong. I'm not fighting to save Insomnia.
Dialogue: You've got it all wrong. I'm not fighting to save Insomnia.

Original: Chancellor Izunia:So this is the might of the Old Wall. Marvelous. Truly marvelous.
Dialogue: So this is the might of the Old Wall. Marvelous. Truly marvelous.

Original: Nyx:Why'd you do it?
Dialogue: Why'd you do it?

Original: Drautos/Glauca:Lucis. Niflheim. It isn'twhowe fight for that matters, only what. We fight for our homes. That is where our allegiance lies.
Dialogue: Lucis. Niflheim. It isn'twhowe fight for that matters, only what. We fight for our homes. That is where our allegiance lies.

Original: Libertus:That's not something you see every day.
Dialogue: That's not something you see every day.

Original: Chancellor Izunia:Oh, such a pitiable waste. All those beautiful city streets, all laid to unsightly ruin.
Dialogue: Oh, such a pitiable waste. All those beautiful city streets, all laid to unsightly ruin.

Original: Emperor Aldercapt:I will return to Niflheim.
Dialogue: I will return to Niflheim.

Original: Chancellor Izunia:So soon?
Dialogue: So soon?

Original: Emperor Aldercapt:The Crystal is ours. Finish this, and see the daemons disposed of.
Dialogue: The Crystal is ours. Finish this, and see the daemons disposed of.

Original: Chancellor Izunia:As you command. Such a pitiable waste...
Dialogue: As you command. Such a pitiable waste...

Original: Nyx:How could you serve the Empire? After everything they did!
Dialogue: How could you serve the Empire? After everything they did!

Original: Drautos/Glauca:I do not fault them for taking what was given. I fault the man who gave it. The man who cowered behind his Wall and abandoned us to save his throne and his son. Give me the Ring, and our homes will be free again. The Empire has promised it.
Dialogue: I do not fault them for taking what was given. I fault the man who gave it. The man who cowered behind his Wall and abandoned us to save his throne and his son. Give me the Ring, and our homes will be free again. The Empire has promised it.

Original: Nyx:I don't see much of a future on the other side of that promise.
Dialogue: I don't see much of a future on the other side of that promise.

Original: Drautos/Glauca:Don't be a fool. Save your friends. Give your dead sister peace. What do you fight for, if not that?
Dialogue: Don't be a fool. Save your friends. Give your dead sister peace. What do you fight for, if not that?

Original: Libertus:Hang on. This could get bumpy.
Dialogue: Hang on. This could get bumpy.

Original: Libertus:Here, take the wheel.
Dialogue: Here, take the wheel.

Original: Libertus:Floor it!
Dialogue: Floor it!

Original: Libertus:Just keep your foot on the gas.
Dialogue: Just keep your foot on the gas.

Original: Libertus:You're alright?
Dialogue: You're alright?

Original: Libertus:I'll be waiting for you, hero.
Dialogue: I'll be waiting for you, hero.

Original: Drautos/Glauca:What of your kings's power now? They've given you a burden you cannot hope to bear. I told you before :just wanting doesn't win wars.
Dialogue: What of your kings's power now? They've given you a burden you cannot hope to bear. I told you before just wanting doesn't win wars.

Original: Drautos/Glauca:For the honor of my home, I fought and killed under a king I loathed. And still, he betrayed me. He betrayed usall.
Dialogue: For the honor of my home, I fought and killed under a king I loathed. And still, he betrayed me. He betrayed usall.

Original: Nyx:We fought for the same thing. All of us. But you've looked too long on the past, you're blind to the future.
Dialogue: We fought for the same thing. All of us. But you've looked too long on the past, you're blind to the future.

Original: Drautos/Glauca:Predictable. Unlike you, I learn from history.
Dialogue: Predictable. Unlike you, I learn from history.

Original: Nyx:But you're a slave to the past.
Dialogue: But you're a slave to the past.

Original: Drautos/Glauca:A man's past is his pride.
Dialogue: A man's past is his pride.

Original: Nyx:No. My pride is shaping the future.
Dialogue: No. My pride is shaping the future.

Original: Nyx:Looks like I'm gonna owe him big.
Dialogue: Looks like I'm gonna owe him big.

Original: Lunafreya:We're almost there.
Dialogue: We're almost there.

Original: Nyx:King Regis did what he did for the future. Because of him, there's still hope for our homes.
Dialogue: King Regis did what he did for the future. Because of him, there's still hope for our homes.

Original: Nyx:Not the worst way to go. Rule well, young king.
Dialogue: Not the worst way to go. Rule well, young king.

Original: Libertus:We should move. It ain't safe here either. Hey, don't worry about Nyx. He can take care of himself. Come on.
Dialogue: We should move. It ain't safe here either. Hey, don't worry about Nyx. He can take care of himself. Come on.

Original: Lunafreya:No. We must part ways here.
Dialogue: No. We must part ways here.

Original: Lunafreya:I can hardly travel in secrecy alongside so great a hero. And I, too, have a promise to keep to Nyx. I pray you two see each other again soon.
Dialogue: I can hardly travel in secrecy alongside so great a hero. And I, too, have a promise to keep to Nyx. I pray you two see each other again soon.

Original: Libertus:Yeah. Me, too.
Dialogue: Yeah. Me, too.

Original: Lunafreya:Thank you, Libertus.
Dialogue: Thank you, Libertus.

Original: Libertus:Hey, queen! You and the king are always welcome in Galahd! Me and Nyx will be waiting for you!
Dialogue: Hey, queen! You and the king are always welcome in Galahd! Me and Nyx will be waiting for you!

Original: Ignis Scientia:It's been some while. Do you remember the last time you saw Lady Lunafreya?
Dialogue: It's been some while. Do you remember the last time you saw Lady Lunafreya?

Original: Noctis:About twelve years ago.
Dialogue: About twelve years ago.

Original: Prompto Argentum:That would make you eight? You were kids!
Dialogue: That would make you eight? You were kids!

Original: Gladiolus Amicitia:Hope she hasn't gotten her hopes up.
Dialogue: Hope she hasn't gotten her hopes up.

Original: Noctis:Why not?(to Prompto, who laughs)Calm yourself.
Dialogue: Why not?(to Prompto, who laughs)Calm yourself.

Original: Gladiolus:Try and keep it together when you meet her.
Dialogue: Try and keep it together when you meet her.

Original: Ignis:She'll expect to see a fine young prince.
Dialogue: She'll expect to see a fine young prince.

Original: Noctis:Tell me something I don't know.
Dialogue: Tell me something I don't know.

Original: Ignis:We don't have time for all that. But this is your wedding we're talking about, Noct.
Dialogue: We don't have time for all that. But this is your wedding we're talking about, Noct.

Original: Noctis:Knew that, too.(to Prompto, who laughs again)You really gotta calm down.
Dialogue: Knew that, too.(to Prompto, who laughs again)You really gotta calm down.

Original: Gladiolus:What do you mean, "uh-oh?"
Dialogue: What do you mean, "uh-oh?"

Original: Noctis:I think I know.
Dialogue: I think I know.
